intro: Ponthieva glandulosa var. rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated ponthieva, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive rostrate (beak-like) inflorescence. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with glandular hairs, which contribute to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
